<letter id="nib5346">
<recipient first="Daniel" last="Webster" type="individual"/>
<p>
And 3 <a rel="month origin" value="2">Feby</a> <a rel='day origin' value='27'>27</a>. <a href='/results.php?year=1843' rel="origin">1843</a> 
</p><p>
My dear Sir, 
</p><p>
I beg you to listen to the following oracular sentences 
which if they have no other inspiration are dictated by a 
public regard for you &amp; for the Country. 
</p><p>
Do not leave your present position! 
</p><p>
If you do, you descend 
</p><p>
You must hereafter be only a king or a king maker. 
</p><p>
You can do nothing abroad which you cannot do better 
while you remain here &amp; speak thro your agents as Secretary you are the Gov* as a Minister you are the Government's agent. 
</p><p>
Then if you go who is to take your place? 
</p><p>
Some transcendentalist some cobweb spinner. 
</p><p>
So stay stay 
</p><p>
Having delivered myself of these profundities I descend from my tripod &amp; am 
</p>
</letter>
